author:
Neill Ostrout
Journal Inquirer
title: Possessed
text:
John Raoux Shaquill Griffin, Alec Bloom 
Central Florida defensive back Shaquill Griffin, back left, breaks up a pass intended for Connecticut tight end Alec Bloom (86) during the first half of an NCAA college football game, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015, in Orlando, Fla. (AP Photo/John Raoux) Posted: Wednesday, October 21, 2015 10:08 am | Updated: 10:10 am, Wed Oct 21, 2015. Possessed By Neill OstroutJournal Inquirer Journal Inquirer | 0 comments 
STORRS — Cincinnati is the new Connecticut. 
Well, at least in football terms. And only if you’re talking about turnovers. 
One of the UConn football team’s biggest problems in Bob Diaco’s first year as head coach was the fact that it committed numerous painful and untimely turnovers.
